messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Nihonto Events in Europe
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Doug and Jim Thank you for the informations. I will check it out. I hope I can find so any events near Switzerland. Reading books is certainy very important
messages.messageBody:
Hi Doug and Jim

Thank you for the informations. I will check it out. I hope I can find so any events near Switzerland.

Reading books is certainy very important to have the basic informations. But it doesn't replace the studying on the objects itsselfs. And this opportunity I hadn't yet, till today. We will see...

Thank's

Ricci

"Doug E. Lewis" <ashigaru1@...> wrote:
hi Ricci,

this is the web site for the Token Society of Great Britain
http://www.to-ken.com/

there are also very active clubs in Denmark [must speak Danish!!] and
Germany

the GB guys can help ya out for all of Europe, i would think.

good luck

doug e

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Nihonto Events in Europe
messages.msgSnippet: Ricci, The NBTHK European branch meetings are held in various locations including Germany and on occasion in Switzerland I believe.  Michael Hagenbusch is the
messages.messageBody:
Ricci,
The NBTHK European branch meetings are held in various locations including Germany and on occasion in Switzerland I believe. Michael Hagenbusch is the president.

The address listed in the front of Solingen Museum show catalog "Selected Fine Japanese Swords from European NBTHK Collections" is:

NBTHK European Branch
Artur - Kutscher - Platz 2
80802 Munchen

Jim



Hi

I'm looking for informations about events in Europe (or better Switzerland
/ Germany) to study nihontos. Is there any Informations-Source on the web
especially for Europe ? I heard about a Europen Branch of the NBTHK. Does
anyone know the adress ?

I havn't found yet any location here in Switzerland, where I could appreciate
nihontos.

Thank's for your help.

Regards

Ricci

messages.subject: Nihonto Events in Europe
messages.msgSnippet: Hi I m looking for informations about events in Europe (or better Switzerland / Germany) to study nihontos. Is there any Informations-Source on the web
messages.messageBody:
Hi

I'm looking for informations about events in Europe (or better Switzerland
/ Germany) to study nihontos. Is there any Informations-Source on the web
especially for Europe ? I heard about a Europen Branch of the NBTHK. Does
anyone know the adress ?

I havn't found yet any location here in Switzerland, where I could appreciate
nihontos.

Thank's for your help.

Regards

Ricci
